column2: also called the '''windy Bay of Bel'''
column4: p. 15</ref> was a great gulf of the [[Belegaer|Great Sea]] lying to the south of [[Gondor]]
column5: within whose waters stood the island of [[Tolfalas]]; the River [[Anduin]] flowed into the Bay. Directly north of the Bay was the Gondorian region of [[Belfalas]].<ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref>

column1: The shores around the Bay were mostly desolate in the [[Second Age]]
column2: except from a [[First Age]] settlement of [[Sindar]] which became the haven [[Edhellond]].<ref>{{PM|Atani}}</ref><ref>{{PM|XNotes}}
the Bay of Belfalas was much filled at the east and south
column3: and land upheaved around it. Anduin carved a new path by many [[Ethir Anduin|mouths]] to the Bay.<ref>{{PM|Second}}</ref> Tolfalas was almost destroyed
column4: and was left at last like a barren and lonely mountain in the water not far from the issue of the River.

column1: The coasts of Gondor were assaulted by the [[Corsairs of Umbar]]. In {{TA|2758}} three fleets from [[Umbar]] attacked and waged war on all the Gondorian coasts until [[Beregond (Steward of Gondor)|Beregond]] overcame the invaders.<ref>{{App|Gondor}}</ref>

column2: the Bay of Belfalas was called '''''[[Côf]] Belfalas'''''
column3: or '''''Côf [[gwaeren]] Bêl''''' ("the windy Bay of Bêl").<ref name=VT/>

column1: The name ''Belfalas'' is composed of [[Mannish]] ''[[bel]]'' + Sindarin ''[[falas]]''.<ref name=VT/>
